page.title: 03AROUND SHERE 1
page.content: There are in fact 53 old houses in the village of Shere. Many are timber framed. Those in the centre of the village were built mainly in the 16th and 17th century. We have chosen to write about a few of them. We looked at the Old Forge and the Old Prison in Lower Street. Both these were built in the early 17th century. The Forge was once used as a wheelwrights. The Old Prison still has bars on the front window, but today it is someones house. In the centre of Shere next to the Tillingbourne stream in Middle Street there is The Pound. This used to be used as an enclosure for animals when farmers brought them to the village. Today it is often used at the weekends by people selling refreshments for charity or by visitors sitting on the seat in the Pound,enjoying the view.
